title: Modeling Coverage for Neural Machine Translation
abstract: However, attentional NMT ignores past alignment information, which leads to over-translation and under-translation problems. In response to this problem, we maintain a coverage vector to keep track of the attention history. The coverage vector is fed to the attention model to help adjust the future attention, which guides NMT to pay more attention to the untranslated source words. Experiments show that coverage-based NMT significantly improves both alignment and translation quality over NMT without coverage.
histories: Results over a stronger NMT baseline, which is now comparable with Moses
Accepted by ACL 2016, Proceedings of the 54th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (2016)
The paper is accepted by ACL 2016
Add subjective evaluation on top of ACL version: 25% of source words are under-translated by NMT
